decks.notes: The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to deploy aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear early on, while utilizing cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help with card advantage and selection. The deck aims to play fast and pressure the opponent, quickly reducing their life total to zero before they have a chance to stabilize. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to both red and blue mana sources.

The deck focuses on accelerating mana production to ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures while controlling the game with removal spells and disruptive effects. It aims to use cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Talisman of Impulse to generate extra mana, allowing for early plays of Eldrazi threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Devourer of Destiny. The deck also includes board wipes like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to clear the opponent's creatures while using cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms for additional control. Lategame threats like World Breaker and Sire of Seven Deaths can help close out the game once the deck has established dominance.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Indomitable Creativity and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to create powerful combos and overwhelm your opponent. The deck focuses on utilizing cards that manipulate the graveyard, such as Persist and Faithless Looting, to set up these combos. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to control the board. The deck incorporates a mix of creatures and spells to keep the opponent on their toes and ultimately win through creative and unexpected plays.

This deck focuses on using mill cards to force the opponent to draw out their entire deck, while also utilizing counter spells and removal to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By consistently milling the opponent's library, the deck aims to win by decking out the opponent or by reducing their life total with cards like Tasha's Hideous Laughter. Jace, the Perfected Mind serves as a powerful win condition once the opponent's library is sufficiently depleted. The deck also includes key land destruction cards like Field of Ruin to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cast powerful threats like Primeval Titan. The deck utilizes land synergy and tutor effects to assemble combo pieces such as Malevolent Rumble and Scapeshift to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Urza's Saga allows for additional utility and the ability to search for key artifacts. The deck aims to control the game early and then finish with a powerful combo or a massive Primeval Titan attack.

This deck revolves around quickly ramping up mana and playing powerful land cards to generate a strong board presence and overwhelm opponents. The goal is to efficiently utilize land recursion and mana acceleration to quickly get Primeval Titan onto the battlefield, fetching key lands like Gruul Turf and Urza's Saga to create a powerful combo. By utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor, the deck aims to generate explosive turns that can quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on ramping mana quickly to play powerful land-based combo pieces, such as Primeval Titan and Scapeshift, which can quickly close out games. It also utilizes cards like Amulet of Vigor and Urza's Saga to generate additional value and speed up the combo. With a mix of strong lands and creatures, the deck aims to assemble its key pieces efficiently and overwhelm opponents with powerful big plays. Additionally, the inclusion of toolbox cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Expedition Map adds versatility and consistency to the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter allows for repeatable use of key spells like Orim's Chant or Counterspell. The deck also has a strong finisher in Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. By managing the board and hand advantage, it seeks to outvalue the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Allosaurus Rider combo to quickly summon powerful creatures onto the battlefield. By sacrificing smaller creatures and utilizing cards such as Eldritch Evolution and Neoform, the deck can quickly ramp up to summon big threats like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand. The deck also includes cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opponents. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to efficiently assemble the Allosaurus Combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to generate multiple land drops in one turn, enabling powerful combos with cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. The deck includes various utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to support its game plan, while also including cards like Arboreal Grazer and Icetill Explorer to ramp up quickly. With the ability to generate large amounts of mana and quickly assemble game-ending combos, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents in the mid to late game.

This deck revolves around generating a large amount of mana quickly to ramp up to playing Primeval Titan and other powerful creatures efficiently. The key concept is to use cards like Amulet of Vigor and Arboreal Grazer to rapidly ramp your mana, while utilizing land search spells like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith to find your key combo pieces. The deck is focused on creating a powerful board state and overwhelming your opponent with massive creatures and game-ending combos.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and spells. By using a combination of powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to quickly lower the opponent's life total and secure a victory. The inclusion of cards like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer helps maintain card advantage and board presence. The deck also includes some disruptive elements like Static Prison to control the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan with counter spells, removal spells, and hand disruption. By controlling the board and keeping the opponent's resources in check with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to maintain a dominant position on the battlefield. Additionally, the inclusion of card draw and card advantage engines like Preordain and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps to ensure a steady stream of resources while building towards powerful late game threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by ramping up mana quickly using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble, while also generating advantage with Sowing Mycospawn and Devourer of Destiny. The deck can quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to dominate the late game. The deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with a combination of control elements and powerful Eldrazi creatures.

This combo deck focuses on using Shifting Woodland to manipulate the top of the library and generate card advantage with Oracle of Tragedy and Quantum Riddler. Thundertrap Trainer and Flame of Anor provide additional control while setting up for powerful plays with Omniscience. Cards like Unholy Heat and Flare of Denial help to protect the combo pieces while digging for key cards with Faithless Looting and Stock Up. The deck also includes some disruption with Spell Snare and interaction with cards like Wrenn and Six. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's strategy.
